whole_text:
REPORT

Clinical Indication: CERVICAL RADICULOPATHY. 

Structured report code: 17.MSK1

Procedure:  XR Spine Cervical 4-5 Views. 

Comparison: None.

VIEWS: 5

Findings: AP, lateral, oblique and odontoid radiographs of the cervical spine
were obtained. On the lateral view, the spine is seen from the skull base
through the cervicothoracic junction. Lower cervical disc space narrowing is
noted, most pronounced at C5-C6 and C6-C7. Right greater than left facet
overgrowth is seen at C3-4 and C4-C5. Right greater than left uncovertebral
hypertrophy is present at C5-C6 and C6-C7. The C1-C2 articulation is within
normal limits. Vascular clips are seen within the thyroid bed on the left.
Trachea is within the midline. There is no prevertebral soft tissue swelling.

Impression: Mild multilevel cervical spondylosis (right greater than left).
cpt_code_description: radiologic examination, chest; single view, frontal
icd_code_description: Symptoms, signs and abnormal clinical and laboratory findings, not elsewhere classified

whole_text:
REPORT

XR Chest 1 View Portable

CLINICAL: Check central line placement  
COMPARISON: 2/2/2016

FINDINGS: 

Support devices: There is a new right IJ Swan-Ganz catheter with the tip
overlying the expected location of the main pulmonary artery.

CHEST: 

Heart and mediastinum: Stable cardiomegaly. Stable bilateral hilar prominence.

Lungs/pleura: Worsening pulmonary edema. Increasing small bilateral pleural
effusions, larger on the right side. No pneumothorax.

Bones and soft tissues: No acute abnormality.

IMPRESSION:  


1. Right IJ Swan-Ganz catheter tip in the main pulmonary artery.
2. Cardiomegaly, worsening pulmonary edema, and increasing small right greater
than left pleural effusions.
cpt_code_description: radiologic examination, chest; single view, frontal
